caption: Definitely a tranquil place. People laughing walking by, sit down and relax with a good breeze during summer.
Small peaceful Parc near Mongallet metro station
Lovely Park filled with kids!

Quite a beautiful square, built on the site of King Dagobert's Merovingian manor! There are play areas for children. Well flowered, it has a scent of roses in its eastern part. Some beautiful trees and well-kept lawns.  On the other hand, the Blue Whale Square üêã is too mineral for my taste.  There are a lot of children so don't expect maximum peace and quiet, but it's a good park for families

Vast square with trees and flowers, it is well laid out. It has a large children's play area. This garden occupies the site of the Merovingian manor of King Dagobert. In the 18th century, a convent of nuns, the Mathurines, was established there, replaced in the 19th century by a spinning mill and then by a wallpaper factory. Shaded by Italian poplars, blue Atlas cedars, maples, birches and Austrian pines, it has in its center the Whale Fountain created in 1982 by Michel Le Corre.

Installation of the perfect dog park, there are trash cans at the entrance. The best thing would have been to have a water point for the dogs. There are obstacle courses to train the dogs and the other dogs in the neighborhood make good playmates. I recommend
It is a very large square which is made up of several places to relax. A sporty side and another side for children. It's very nice to come back.

An esplanade with very nice games for children. Perfect for spending time with family. On the other hand, the square is surrounded by blocks of buildings, it's not the best. Finally, if you are a hunter, you will be able to find food, especially rats, in large quantities.

Pretty nice park. However, the benches are generally dirty and in direct sunlight. Why not put back shades like 2 years ago? The toilets are disgusting, the dogs in the dog area are often very noisy. Also note that cyclists cross the park on bikes even though it is forbidden, but since the supervisors are most often absent...and when they are there they let it happen...! Children have fun throwing sand and gravel into the whale's tank, under the generally indifferent eye of their parents. Despite everything, it's good to stay there at certain times...and avoiding school outing times in the area.
Always good to have a small green space near your home, games for children and a dog park. The place would benefit from being modernized, but remains pleasant

Square Saint-√âloi is a charming green space nestled in the 12th arrondissement of Paris. This small park offers a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere, ideal for a walk or a moment of relaxation. The well-kept gardens, shaded benches and children's play areas make it a popular place for families and local residents. Its location close to several tourist sites and the metro makes it a pleasant stopover when exploring the city. A haven of tranquility in the heart of Parisian urban life.
Not bad but sometimes dirty pigeons come to post-industrialize the leases. To the jeve!
Best dog park in the neighborhood! Some facilities for dogs, dirty benches for owners. There are also gardens, a p√©tanque area, ping pong tables, great games for children.

A very nice little neighborhood square, clean, pretty and very practical! The activities are varied for children, between the slides and the sandbox, the dog area is also an excellent initiative for dog owners! On the other side, the whale fountain surrounded by flowery spaces constitutes a very pleasant place to relax.
There is a decent basketball court
I spent 3 hours in this park and even if it is shaded.  It is invaded by rats. I saw at least 5 of them.  Avoid with children because rats approach people without fear.

Dog park to avoid... extremely small and without trash can or fountain. Out of 4 owners of crossed dogs, 3 were respectful, the last one, a disaster! She didn't want her dog to play with the others, and dared to grab the dogs by the scruff of the neck to shake them, unacceptable! I came for the park facilities, but I prefer to go closer to home, even without facilities, the parks are bigger, with trash cans and a fountain, and the people are more respectful

I didn't know about this large open park, there is something for everyone. I'm making Paris unknown, it's really unknown. The whale is impressive when we arrive at it, a little damaged something needs to be done

Very diverse and full of life square, allowing everyone to find what they are looking for, with benches, flowers, stretches of grass, sports areas, children's park, fountain and dog park (a little extra in this Paris that is so unwelcoming for our 4-legged friends just waiting to flourish). Despite all the disparaging remarks from people who can't stand any noise (a shame when you decide to live in Paris ;)), this square must continue to receive all the life brought by young and old like our canine friends. As for those who find this square unpleasant since the arrival of the dogs (no noisier than a group of 5 children playing in the games or a playground (even two right next door!)), I can only hope that one day you will find a little more tolerance for what you do not know, life will be much more beautiful for you ;) a word to the wise!

It was an excellent idea, but the location is stupid: near the sandbox and lawn for the children, runoff of dog urine, barking practically all day and non-compliance with the instructions posted at the entrance now make it a place to escape, it's a wart in what was a superb park. Some aggressive dogs dissuaded the calm and respectful dogs and owners who frequented this beautiful place. A place to avoid unfortunately!! Parents refuse to let their children play there now. Thanks to the municipality for this absurd achievement which could be put elsewhere (town hall square for example!!)

I've been going there since I was little and it has everything you need, two large sports fields, games suitable for all ages, sports machines, a dog park, a sandbox and lawn. There are even toilets and a water fountain! In short, everything we would like to have in a park is transcribed in this one. ideal for children, really well done

Well-maintained neighborhood square so children can play close to home. Park with few trees, the benches are in the sun all day. Remember to take a cap and sunscreen. There is a drinking water fountain available...

Very nice park with lots of games for children for all ages (from young to old) large sandbox, sports equipment for adults. It also has ping pong tables, p√©tanque court, area for dogs, an area to run around the famous whale, a small rose garden. Far from cars and next to the Saint Eloi library. One of the nicest in Paris.
Pretty little square with games for children and a park for dogs.

Although located in the center of uninviting collective housing, this square is one of the best in the 12th.  At first, a little reluctant to take my daughter there for fear of meeting "low-rise cuties", I take her there regularly and there are more nice parents than needy tramps. waking hours, at least you have to choose your times of passage.  Many games for children and a rather large space compared to average. Note the presence of 3 sports training machines.  I really like the sculpture of the whale covered in mosaic which is in the center of a fountain that is too rarely in water. Better maintenance and respect for this work would not be amiss.
Square with a space for young children, an adult gym area to practice some exercises and a space for playful dog activities is also available. Fixed ping pong tables are available in the shade.
Small green spaces, large sandbox, sports equipment for adults, games for children,... And recently a park for dogs! Without a small cafe/bar/sandwich shop.

I went there on purpose for the dog park: closed until further notice. What a pain, there were agility modules :-( So, I went to the one on rue de la Roquette, long, lots of benches but there again, like the one in Batignolles, one wonders why they leave such coverings on the ground, tar in Batignolles, slabs of I don't know what about Roquette: it's completely absurd! What fun for our dogs, not to mention that it heats up as soon as there is sunshine?! A positive point at La Roquette: there is a fountain!

The whale square is the meeting place for little ones in the sandbox and around the play area. There are also Ping Pong tables and a blue whale fountain that works in summer. There are multiple access points, on one side you have a library not far away and on the other the street of computer stores

A garden for children, especially after school with their parents and especially their mothers, a sandbox, outdoor games but also a fountain and above all a superb blue whale and a small lake for the ducks!
Excellent experience.  Kindness and smiles, despite the different language. Everything was entrusted to empathy

Park not yet open almost an hour after the theoretical opening time, and this is far from the first time this has happened. Too bad for those who want to enjoy it for a short while before going to work.
Very quiet park, I went there for that and to eat in peace. Large space with several pleasant little corners.

The toilets are.... disgusting... not washed for... a very, very long time... we're talking weeks or months... lots of children from the neighborhood, and buildings around play in this square. It's pathetic :(
Superb flower beds and thanks to the gardeners at Paris City Hall
A calm and pleasant garden, for adults and children. A haven of greenery in the 12th.
Jardin St Eloi known as the whale garden which is located at the entrance to the garden on the Moynet city side. It is popular with children from the surrounding towns.

Too bad for the toilet in any case well done for the planting but we go there or there is the fountain well as soon as we put a play in the water he goes straight into the sewers and a shame to have to remove the spinner in the play area and there is no Wi Fi even though it says at the Wi Fi entrance, connect etc etc etc
